boardgame.name: Bios: Genesis
boardgame.description: Description from the publisher:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Bios: Genesis, one to four players start as organic compounds shortly after Earth's formation, represented by up to three Biont tokens. The Amino Acids command Metabolism, the lipids create cells, the pigments control energy absorption and storage, and the nucleic acids control templated replication. Their goal is a double origin of life: first as Autocatalytic Life (a metabolic cycle reproducing, yet not replicating, its own constituents), and the second as Darwinian Life (an Organism using a template to replicate in an RNA world). Players can play cooperative, competitive, or solitaire._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Notes designer Phil Eklund, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;This subject is the most difficult and ambitious I have ever attempted, and it has taken many years to get it to work right._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; With Bios: Genesis, Bios: Megafauna, and Origins: How We Became Human, Eklund takes players through almost the whole breadth and scope of life on Earth._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: clp053 – cubelove podcast – We Talk About Games
Episode 30 - Getting Feudum And Other Big Box Games To Table
Episode 9: Phil Eklund_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Adventures In Cube Repression
The Game Pit: Episode 87 - Review of 2016 including Top 5s
The Good The Board and Man Who Loves It All: Episode 93 “Trent’s Top 10 of 2016″
Vox Republica 141: Science Is Your Friend

Game: Bios: Genesis 2 (Sierra Madre Games) Condition: new in shrinkwrap Language: English This is for a pre-order of the game. Will arrive in November! Thanks in advance for ordering! See below for information on shipping, payment _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; cancellation. Payment: Bank transfer to an EU bank account using IBAN/BIC in advance (normally free of charge if your bank account is nominated in EURO) Paypal (add 3,- Euro to cover the fees. That should be the first choice for non-EU customers.) Pick up the game at my game store (no shipping cost) Shipping: always insured and with tracking Germany: 5,99€ for the first item card games or smaller boxes might be cheaper (please contact me beforehand) EU: 13,99€ up to 2kg 15,99€ up to 5kg 20,99€ up to 10kg Rest of the world: Please contact me before purchasing an item to clarify the shipping costs. I can offer discounts on shipping if multiple marketplace purchases are made. Returns and Cancellation: You may cancel your order without giving any reasons within 14 days after placing your order. Please contact frank@spieleberatung.com and I will attempt to resolve the matter. Unopened copies of the game that are no longer wanted can be returned, but there is a 10% restocking fee payable of the item price and the buyer is responsible for the return shipping costs. Spieleberatung Frank Solnitzky Hainbuchenweg 1 36381 Schlüchtern Germany +49-06661-9115039 frank@spieleberatung.com

The first in the sequence of Bios games starts with the building blocks of life. It ends with the first creatures, ready to evolve into everything else. It is explicitly a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;brutal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; game as players create micro-organisms that try to survive and grow in a hostile environment. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £25.0 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country. I charge shipping at cost, as follows. UK addresses: £2.79 (myHermes, takes 2-3 working days, tracked) Other EU countries: £7.44 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Europe outside the EU: £6.20 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) Australasia: £9.20 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked) USA, Canada _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; elsewhere: £8.50 (Air mail, takes 1 week or so, not tracked)

This is NOT a complete version of Bios Genesis (1st ed), but rather all the components that were replaced with the upgrade pack to the 2d edition. Does not include the box. Includes: * 16 oversized square placards representing the Refugia/bacteria * 60 bridge-sized cards (2.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; x 3.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;): 4 player cards, 4 landform active/inactive markers, 20 mutations, 24 events, 8 macro-organisms * first edition rules (though I would recommend playing with the most updated living rules, here: https://goo.gl/wW5c1M) You need to source the following for yourself: * 12 (or more) d6 (six-sided dice) * 64 cubes (in 4 colors, 16 each of red, yellow, green, blue) (or more—cubes are not piece limited in the game); size is 8mm * 48 discs (in 4 colors, 12 each of red, yellow, green, blue) * box or other form of storage You could source the components from the Game Crafter or any other relevant supplier. Example wishlist: https://goo.gl/3r4mfg
New in shrink, $11.00 shipping to the US.

The first in the sequence of Bios games starts with the building blocks of life. It ends with the first creatures, ready to evolve into everything else. It is explicitly a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;brutal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; game as players create micro-organisms that try to survive and grow in a hostile environment. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £25.0 (net of UK tax) - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country.
